{
  "article_text": [
    "given a 3-manifold @xmath0 , a ring @xmath3 and an invertible element @xmath4 in @xmath3 , the kauffman bracket skein module is the free @xmath3-module generated by isotopy classes of banded links in @xmath0 modulo local relations depending on @xmath4 @xcite . when @xmath5 and @xmath6 , the disjoint union operation makes it into the algebra of regular functions on the character variety of @xmath7 into @xmath8 .",
    "when @xmath4 is a root of unity ( say of order @xmath9 ) , this module can be used to construct the topological quantum field theory with level @xmath10 .",
    "the purpose of this article is to study specifically the case when @xmath11/(\\epsilon^2)$ ] and @xmath12 : we call it the _ derived skein module _ of @xmath0 .",
    "if @xmath13 $ ] , the derived kauffman module is again an algebra , deforming the one with @xmath14 : the deformation corresponds to the goldman poisson bracket as already observed in @xcite .",
    "if @xmath0 is a 3-manifold with boundary , the derived kauffman module is a module over the derived kauffman algebra of the neighborhood of the boundary .",
    "we show in this article that this structure is described by a second order differential operator on the character variety of @xmath0 ( more precisely , on its restriction to the character variety of the boundary of @xmath0 ) .",
    "we conjecture that this operator @xmath15 is given by @xmath16 where @xmath17 is a regular function on the character variety of @xmath18 vanishing on the restriction of characters of @xmath0 , @xmath19 is its hamiltonian vector field and @xmath20 is the ( twisted ) reidemeister torsion",
    ". we may think of this operator as a kind of symplectic laplacian .",
    "we prove this formula for a thickened surface and a handlebody .",
    "it can be also checked by hand for torus knots and for the figure eight knot @xcite .",
    "this formula is a manifestation of a well - known conjectural fact : the asymptotics of quantum invariants of a 3-manifold @xmath0 when the level @xmath10 tends to infinity is governed at first order by the character variety of @xmath0 , the chern - simons functional and the reidemeister torsion .",
    "this fact was already known to e. witten for the case of closed 3-manifolds : various generalizations of the volume conjecture for knots in @xmath21 predict the same kind of phenomena , see for instance @xcite . in @xcite ,",
    "the witten conjecture for the expansion of the witten - reshetikhin - turaev invariants of the dehn fillings of the figure eight knot was obtained by proving another version of the witten conjecture for the figure eight knot complement .",
    "one of the key technical inputs were an explicit differential equation relating the reidemeister torsion to the @xmath22-differential equation satisfied by the colored jones polynomial .",
    "this equation was called the transport equation of the reidemeister torsion , following a standard terminology in semi - classical analysis : it is equivalent to equation in the case of knot complements .",
    "the present article generalizes this transport equation for any manifold with boundary , using the beautiful relation between skein modules and @xmath22-differential equations discovered in @xcite , see @xcite for a review .",
    "the first section starts with a short motivation from quantum topology , then we state the conjecture and explain its relation with the quantum @xmath23-polynomial and the colored jones polynomial . in the second section ,",
    "we prove the formula in the case of thickened surfaces and handlebodies , assuming some familiarity with the symplectic structure on character varieties of surfaces .",
    "the last section presents the notion of twisted self - linking : this takes the form of a map @xmath24 from the derived skein module of @xmath0 to a space @xmath25 depending on a representation @xmath26 . for a knot @xmath27 in @xmath0 ,",
    "the element @xmath28 may be thought of as the self - linking of @xmath27 with coefficients in the adjoint representation @xmath29 and at the same time as the hessian at @xmath30 $ ] of the trace function @xmath31 on the character variety mapping @xmath30 $ ] to @xmath32 .",
    "i believe that this notion should yield a proof of equation .",
    "* acknowledgements :",
    "* i would like to thank l. charles , r. detcherry , m. heusener t. q. t. l and j. porti for their kind interest relating these questions .",
    "let @xmath0 be a closed oriented 3-manifold satisfying @xmath33 .",
    "suppose moreover that for any non - trivial ( and hence irreducible ) representation @xmath26 we have @xmath34 .",
    "this is equivalent to the assumption that the following character variety is reduced and of dimension 0 : @xmath35    the witten - reshetikhin - turaev invariant of @xmath0 with gauge group su@xmath36 and level @xmath10 is a topological invariant of @xmath0 denoted by @xmath37 which conjecturally satisfies the following expansion :    @xmath38 in this formula , @xmath39 runs over conjugacy classes of non trivial morphisms from @xmath7 to su@xmath36 and @xmath40 , @xmath41 and @xmath42 are topological invariants called respectively the chern - simons invariant , the spectral flow and the reidemeister torsion .",
    "the wrt invariant can be extended to pairs @xmath43 where @xmath44 is a banded link in @xmath0 , that is an oriented submanifold diffeomorphic to a disjoint union of annuli , see for instance @xcite . as an invariant of @xmath44",
    ", it satisfies the celebrated kauffman relations , that is if @xmath45 differ as in figure [ kauf ] , then the invariants should satisfy the following equations where @xmath46 : @xmath47     > 0 18inkscape -z -d file = kaufman.svg export - pdf = kaufman.pdf export - latex    moreover , if @xmath48 is the union of @xmath44 with a trivial banded knot , then one should have @xmath49 .",
    "this invariant was introduced by witten using a path integral that we describe below .",
    "let @xmath50 be a 1-form on @xmath0 with values in the lie algebra su@xmath36 .",
    "we may think of it as a connection on a trivial su@xmath36 principal bundle and introduce the chern - simons action of @xmath51 as the integral @xmath52).\\ ] ] denoting by @xmath53 the components of @xmath44 and by @xmath54 the holonomy of @xmath51 along @xmath53 , one can write the original path integral : @xmath55    the witten conjecture comes from a formal stationary phase expansion in this path integral , observing that critical points of the chern - simons action are flat connections ( i.e. satisfy @xmath56=0 $ ] ) and gauge equivalence class of flat connections correspond to conjugacy class of representations in su@xmath36 .",
    "let @xmath57 be the term corresponding to @xmath39 in the witten expansion of @xmath37 .",
    "if we add the link @xmath44 , the term @xmath58 should be at 0-th order multiplied by the value @xmath59 .",
    "let us denote by @xmath60 the first order term , that is such that the following expansion holds : @xmath61    factorizing @xmath58 , we guess that the kauffman relations should yield : @xmath62    one of the goal of this article is to construct rigorously such an invariant .",
    "heuristically , it should be defined as a contraction of the hessian of the function @xmath63 with the inverse hessian of the chern - simon action .",
    "we did not try to make sense of such a contraction although it was the source of inspiration of the more formal construction developed in section [ selflink ] .",
    "let @xmath3 be a ring and @xmath4 be an invertible element in @xmath3 .",
    "the kauffman skein module @xmath64 of a compact connected 3-manifold @xmath0 ( maybe with boundary ) is defined as the free @xmath3-module generated by isotopy classes of banded links in @xmath0 ( including the empty link ) modulo the kauffman relations @xmath65-t[l_\\infty]-t^{-1}[l_0]$ ] and @xmath66+(t^2+t^{-2})[l]$ ] .",
    "if @xmath5 and @xmath6 , the disjoint union makes @xmath67 into an algebra , isomorphic to the algebra of regular functions on the character variety @xmath68 , see @xcite for a review .",
    "we will be concerned in this article with the _ derived skein module _ which consists in setting @xmath11/(\\epsilon^2)$ ] and @xmath12 . for short",
    ", we will denote the first algebra by @xmath69 and the derived skein module by @xmath70 .",
    "these spaces fit into the following complex :    @xmath71 & \\mathcal{s}(m ) \\ar[r]^{\\times \\epsilon } & \\mathcal{s}'(m)\\ar[r]^{\\mod \\epsilon}&\\mathcal{s}(m)\\ar[r ] & 0}\\ ] ]    [ regularite ] is this complex always exact ?",
    "if so , we will say that @xmath0 is _",
    "regular_.    if @xmath0 is diffeomorphic to a thickened surface of the form @xmath72 $ ] , then stacking a banded link over the other makes @xmath64 into an algebra , commutative if @xmath73 . moreover ,",
    "projecting a link on @xmath74 and recursively solving the crossings show that the _ multicurves _ of @xmath74 - that is embedded 1-manifold without components bounding a disc - form a basis of @xmath64 .",
    "this gives in particular a natural isomorphism @xmath75/(\\epsilon^2)$ ] , making the complex of equation exact .",
    "however , one should be careful that the preceding isomorphism is not an isomorphism of algebras as one has for @xmath76 and @xmath77 in @xmath69 the following identity : @xmath78 where @xmath79 is the goldman poisson bracket @xcite .",
    "this formula shows that the derived skein module of a thickened surface @xmath80 $ ] reflects the poisson structure of the character variety @xmath81 , so that one is naturally leaded to ask whether the derived skein module of a manifold @xmath0 with boundary @xmath74 contains some geometric structure related to the character variety @xmath68 .",
    "having very little structure , the derived skein module @xmath70 is by itself no much information , however , we will exploit the relation between the derived skein module of @xmath0 and the one of a neighborhood of its boundary .",
    "let @xmath0 be a 3-manifold with boundary @xmath74 and denote by @xmath82 a tubular neighborhood of @xmath74 , hence homeomorphic to a thickened surface . the inclusion map @xmath83 induces a map @xmath84 .",

    "the colored jones polynomials were packaged into a sequence of holomorphic sections over the standard torus @xmath137 , @xmath138 where @xmath44 is a pre - quantum bundle and @xmath139 a half - form bundle .",
    "this sequence were called the _ knot state _ and were the main ingredient for the proof of the witten expansion conjecture for the manifolds obtained by dehn fillings along the figure - eight knot . in that case",
    ", it was shown in @xcite that the state @xmath140 is a lagrangian state , concentrating on @xmath87 , with phase the chern - simons action and amplitude the reidemeister torsion .",
    "it followed from an interpretation of the equation @xmath141 as a toeplitz operator annihilating the knot state @xmath140 .",
    "the reidemeister torsion appeared through a differential equation involving the symbol @xmath142 and the subprincipal symbol @xmath143 of the toeplitz operator @xmath20 .",
    "let us expand on this .",

  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> for a 3-manifold @xmath0 with boundary , we study the kauffman module with indeterminate equal to @xmath1 where @xmath2 . </S>",
    "<S> we conjecture an explicit relation between this module and the reidemeister torsion of @xmath0 which we prove in particular cases . as a maybe useful tool , </S>",
    "<S> we then introduce a notion of twisted self - linking and prove that it satisfies the kauffman relations at first order . </S>",
    "<S> these questions come from considerations on asymptotics of quantum invariants . </S>"
  ]
}
